episodes.title: Episode 61 – Cults
episodes.description:
CULTS, CONSCIOUSNESS & FAME: Are religions just cults that went mainstream?
Is football a cult? Music fandoms? Corporations? Governments?
And what happens when belief systems are taken too far?

In Episode 61 of The Temple Bar Podcast, Jim and Philip take on one of their most wide-ranging and thought-provoking conversations yet — moving from David Koresh, Jim Jones, and Scientology to Sikhism, Jesus, modern celebrity worship, and the illusion of reality itself.

This episode explores how cults form, why people follow them, and how power, fame, and belief can slowly distort even the purest messages. Along the way, the conversation expands into consciousness, duality, free will, simulation theory, and the Law of One, while keeping things grounded with sharp humour, Irish storytelling, and real-world examples.

In this episode, we discuss:
 • What actually defines a cult
 • David Koresh, Waco & Jonestown explained
 • Religion vs cults: Jesus, Sikhism & reformers
 • How belief systems get corrupted over time
 • Celebrity & fame as modern cults (Bono, Kanye, Taylor Swift)
 • Football fandom and tribal identity
 • Free will, manipulation & power
 • Consciousness, duality & reality as a simulation
 • Why light and dark must coexist
 • Christmas parties, chaos & human nature 🍻

This episode doesn’t tell you what to believe — it encourages you to question everything, take what resonates, and leave the rest behind.
